hints.content:
On a clock there are two hands. The $\redD{\text{hour hand}}$ is the shorter hand.  The $\blueE{\text{minute hand}}$ is the longer hand.

![A clock shows the short hour hand is at 5. The long minute hand points to 12.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/45a764740b107b33cf6707c08fe70c7abdbda8c9)

So, $\redD{4}{:}{00} $ looks like this:

![A clock shows the short hour hand is at 4. The long minute hand points to 12. Labels outside the edge of the clock are number 1 through 12.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/2ed7caa12c2157999185ab570034395a4b2fc3dc)

$\redD{4}{:}{\blueE{55}}$ is $\blueE{55}$ ticks from $\redD{4}{:}{00}.$

![A clock shows the short hour hand is at 11. The long minute hand points to 11. Outside the edge of the clock 12 is labeled 0, 1 is labeled 5, 2 is labeled 10, and so on with 11 labeled 55.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/c7c4b8ad9d05de61d68f32596a19ffa6051fdc9b)

Notice the hour hand is past $4{:}00$ but not quite to $5{:}00$.

This clock shows $4{:}{55}$.

![A clock shows the short hour hand is at 5. The long minute hand points to 11.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/c5a9ae7aee11127bfd5b6fe190ebab7264de7290)

choices.content: ![A clock shows the short hour hand is at 5. The long minute hand points to 11.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/c5a9ae7aee11127bfd5b6fe190ebab7264de7290)
![A clock shows the short hour hand is between 3 and 4. The long minute hand points to 11.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/ae08c704aea1021846c87c8e5c8199839b1ea394)
![A clock shows the short hour hand is just past 4. The long minute hand points to 5.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/75374464a07e5af216016119254c54fc43199f67)
